description:
Chrysoteuchia culmella is a species of snout moth that belongs to the family Crambidae. It is a small moth with a wingspan of around 18-25 millimeters. The forewings of C. culmella are pale greyish-brown in color, with indistinct darker markings. The hindwings are greyish-white.

The larvae of C. culmella feed on various grasses, including common reed (Phragmites australis) and other species. The larvae construct a portable case made of silk and plant material, which they carry with them as they feed on the grass foliage.

C. culmella is widely distributed across Europe and parts of Asia, where it is typically found in wetland habitats, such as marshes, fens, and riverbanks, where its host plants are abundant. The species is considered to be a relatively common and widespread member of the Crambidae family.
